page.title: 04Religion
page.content:
There are two places of worship in the centre of Hundon.
"All Saints" Parish Church. The present umcumbant is Father Jeremy Cooper. The Church is thought to have been built circa 1516. The structure is a fine building which stood back from the main street of the village, on the side of the hill. It is an ancient structure of flint, mostly in the perpendicular style , consisting of chancel, nave, chapel aisles,south porch, with a very fine embattled western tower, containing a clock and six bells. A new organ was provided in 1897, and the church partially re-stored and re-seated with open oak benches in 1886. Records dated back to th 15th or 16th Century.
